attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNVSDfcXupHNECMTwd_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class (refer to Animal Stat)
Hit Points (refer to Animal Stat)

Locomotion land; Use the Base Speed of the slowest pulling Animal.

Cargo Capacity: Add the Draft of the animals together and subtract the weight of the vehicle.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNVSDlukZaV8j2sZGq_description
attribs.current:
Actions available during vehicle phase if components are operated.

Move: The wagon can move the speed of its Draft Animals using its Draft Animals. 

Turn: The Wagon can be directed to make turns if the Reins are operated.

Using a Bonus Action one can make a successful DC 15 Animal Handling check for the wagon to "Dash" using the Reins.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNVnAzBNgwLHkEjQZ1_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 18
Hit Points 15

The Reins include the bit, bridle, and yokes for the pulling animal. When operated they allow the wagon to make turns.

Evasive maneuvers can be accomplished with successful Animal Handling checks defined by the DM.

Using a Bonus Action one can make a successful DC 15 Animal Handling check for the wagon to "Dash"

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNVnB6S5Mb7pnTjDNX_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 11
Hit Points 27

A Canvas Covering protects offers protection from the weather for cargo and passengers.

It obscures vision into the vehicle offering concealment (treat creatures under and inside the covering as "invisible").

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNVnBBtjIEMYg7iElZ_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 19
Hit Points 27 (damage threshold 15)

Slats of Iron or Steel are hung from the vehicles sides and roof. It offers protection from the weather. If it has no windows it offers full cover (unseen), otherwise with windows three-quarters (+5 to passenger's AC).

This type of Hull reduces the cargo capacity by 1/4.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNVnBG70QiZWJEH3yy_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 15
Hit Points 27

A Cabin stores cargo and passengers. It offers protection from the weather. If it has no windows it offers full cover (+2 AC and DEX Saves), otherwise with windows three-quarters (+5 to AC and DEX Saves).

attribs.current:
Armor Class (refer to Animal Stat)
Hit Points (refer to Animal Stat)

Locomotion land; For short duration (under an hour) use the Base Speed of the pulling Animal.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNVnBPObYrR8ZzxDT5_name
attribs.current: Carry Capacity: Refer to Draft Animal

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNVnBPObYrR8ZzxDT5_description
attribs.current:
An animal pulling a carriage, cart, chariot, sled, or wagon can move weight up to five times its base carrying Capacity, including the weight of the vehicle. If multiple animals pull the same vehicle, they can add their carrying Capacity together.

*Note: Take the animals Normal Draft and subtract weight of vehicle.*

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNVnBQLRfZ8SFThhdf_description
attribs.current:
X Crew Y Passengers*

*Passengers include Crew of Medium Creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNVnBZIU2jNFANShMr_description
attribs.current:
Fast: 400 ft. /min | 4 miles /hour | 30 miles /day | -5 penalty to passive Wisdom (Perception) scores

Normal: 300 ft./min | 3 miles /hour | 24 miles/ day | no penalty

Slow: 200 ft./min | 2 miles /hour | 18 miles /day | Able to use stealth 

While traveling, a group of Adventurers can move at a normal, fast, or slow pace, as shown on the Travel Pace table. The table states how far the party can move in a period of time and whether the pace has any Effect. A fast pace makes Characters less perceptive, while a slow pace makes it possible to sneak around and to sear⁠ch an area more carefully (see the “Activity While Traveling” later in this section for more information).

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNVnBadhQVRi0bW7MJ_description
attribs.current: A creature that serves as a flying mount must rest 1 hour for every 3 hours it flies, and it can’t fly for more than 9 hours per day. Thus, characters mounted on griffons (which have a flying speed of 80 feet) can travel at 8 miles per hour, covering 72 miles over 9 hours with two 1-hour-long rests over the course of the day. Mounts that don’t tire (such as a flying construct) aren’t subject to this limitation.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNVnBbBYnR4vJk6Hiz_description
attribs.current:
The Travel Pace table assumes that characters travel for 8 hours in the day. They can push on beyond that limit, at the risk of exhaustion.

For each additional hour of travel beyond 8 hours, the characters cover the distance shown in the Hour column for their pace, and each character must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of the hour. The DC is 10 + 1 for each hour past 8 hours. On a failed saving throw, a character suffers one level of exhaustion.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNVnBbBYnR4vJk6Hj1_name
attribs.current: Travel Pace: Lone Rider Full Gallop

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNVnBbBYnR4vJk6Hj1_description
attribs.current: For short spans of time (up to an hour), many animals move much faster than Humanoids. A mounted character can ride at a gallop for about an hour, covering twice the usual distance for a fast pace. If fresh Mounts are available every 8 to 10 miles, Characters can cover larger distances at this pace, but this is very rare except in densely populated areas.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNVnBczicxHIHX722A_description
attribs.current:
Characters in wagons, carriages, or other Land Vehicles choose a pace as normal. Characters in a waterborne vessel are limited to the speed of the vessel (see “ Mounts and Vehicles ”), and they don’t suffer penalties for a fast pace or gain benefits from a slow pace. Depending on the vessel and the size of the crew, ships might be able to Travel for up to 24 hours per day.

Certain speci⁠al Mounts, such as a Pegasus or Griffon, or spe⁠cial vehicles, such as a Carpet of Flying, allow you to Travel more swiftly. The Dungeon Master’s Guide contains more information on spec⁠ial methods of Travel.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNVnBfetloZ-ksKizw_description
attribs.current: Vehicle contains a stove for cooking and hosting a fire to keep passenger and/or cargo warm.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNfVsZh4xyE01-lI1d_description

The vehicle has built-in shelter for cargo and passengers. This provides protection from the elements.

Refer to Hull type for additional effects.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNfqDFV5KAOotTCjZZ_description
attribs.current: The vehicle has a yoke to properly attach X Draft Animals.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNg15Jogw0NFdSkHXT_description
